title.narrative: PIMS 1583 Full BD: Cons of Tra

description.narrative: Des ménaces pèsent sur lEco-région de forêt dense et humide de louest du Bassin du Congo.Les Gouvernements du Cameroun, du Gabon et du Congo visent, par le biais des interventions envisagées dans le cadre du présent projet, à réduire l’impact de ces menaces et à mettre en place les systèmes de gestion des ressources et de financement à long terme qui sont nécessaires pour atteindre les objectifs de conservation. Congo). Le projet aidera les trois gouvernements à concevoir et à mettre en œuvre un plan cohérent d’affectation des terres désignant les aires protégées, les zones forestières permane
capital of a political entity

11 Outcome 1 The landuse and the governance structures of a transborder complex for biodiversity conservation and sustainable natural resource use are designed endorsed and operational
Output 1 TRIDOM zoning is effective through legal endorsement of
three national landuse plans and their implementation

4 11 Landuse plan with legal endorsement
4a Regional
MTR 2012 comments
The target for 4 years as per PRODOC should be the EOP target more realistic

comment.narrative:
Land use plan and governance structure nonexistent only 9 protected areas gazetted
RTA note baseline corrected in the PIR to be in conformity with PRODOC

By midterm The Governments have adopted the legal instruments adopting the land use plan and they cover at least 80 of the 40000 sq km interzone and are published in the national press
Midterm enabling conditions
i Complementary data collection is continued satellite images field checks etc
ii For each country updated thematic land use maps for the interzone and or existing protected areas are produced to serve as a basis for discussion
ii Land use scenarios ensuring that key connectivity areas receive conservation attention are proposed
iii Multilevel stakeholder consultation is conducted on proposed land use scenarios
By EOP
All implementation measures eg gazettement decrees of the land use plans are adopted and enforced
Note on logframe revision MTR recommendation adopted Targets are adjusted down Midterm enabling conditions are also included now RTA endorses the revision of the target

The States Parties during the TriNational Committee for Supervision and Arbitration CTSA grouping representatives of the Governments of the three States Parties approved through a Memorandum of Understanding MOU consensual plan for integrating migration corridors of large mammals in National Plans for Land Use This innovative and efficient tool includes five 5 chapters and twentyseven 27 articles The first chapter deals with general provisions such as the demarcation of the migration corridors of large mammals selected for national and crossborder plans The second chapter deals with the management measures bunk compatible and incompatible uses in the consensual plan of integration corridors The third chapter discusses the contribution to the maintenance and or restoration of migration corridors in conjunction with dealers and others involved in TRIDOM The fourth chapter deals with the implementation and monitoring and evaluation of the MOU at country and subregional levels The last chapter deals with the various and final provisions including the commitment of countries in the process of obtaining the status of transboundary biosphere reserve of UNESCO

By midterm The Governments have adopted the legal instruments adopting the land use plan and they cover at least 80 of the 40000 sq km interzone and are published in the national press

ii Land use scenarios ensuring that key connectivity areas receive conservation attention are proposed
iii Multilevel stakeholder consultation is conducted on proposed land use scenarios
By EOP
All implementation measures eg gazettement decrees of the land use plans are adopted and enforced
Note on logframe revision MTR recommendation adopted Targets are adjusted down Midterm enabling conditions are also included now RTA endorses the revision of the target

The States Parties during the TriNational Committee for Supervision and Arbitration CTSA grouping representatives of the Governments of the three States Parties approved through a Memorandum of Understanding MOU consensual plan for integrating migration corridors of large mammals in National Plans for Land Use This innovative and efficient tool includes five 5 chapters and twentyseven 27 articles The first chapter deals with general provisions such as the demarcation of the migration corridors of large mammals selected for national and crossborder plans The second chapter deals with the management measures bunk compatible and incompatible uses in the consensual plan of integration corridors The third chapter discusses the contribution to the maintenance and or restoration of migration corridors in conjunction with dealers and others involved in TRIDOM The fourth chapter deals with the implementation and monitoring and evaluation of the MOU at country and subregional levels The last chapter deals with the various and final provisions including the commitment of countries in the process of obtaining the status of transboundary biosphere reserve of UNESCO

description.narrative:
12 Outcome 1 The landuse and the governance structures of a transborder complex for biodiversity conservation and sustainable natural resource use are designed endorsed and operational
Output 2 A transboundary status is adopted for the TRIDOM and operational management systems are effective at the regional national and local levels
5 21 Official international status for TRIDOM complex

comment.narrative: Consensus reached on proposed transboundary status of TRIDOM

By EOP The Governments have adopted the legal instruments adopting the land use plan and they cover at least 80 of the 40000 sq km interzone and are published in the national press
By Midterm enabling conditions
i Complementary data collection is continued satellite images field checks etc
ii For each country updated thematic land use maps for the interzone and or existing protected areas are produced to serve as a basis for discussion
ii Land use scenarios ensuring that key connectivity areas receive conservation attention are proposed
iii Multilevel stakeholder consultation is conducted on proposed land use scenarios
Note on logframe revision MTR recommendation adopted Targets are adjusted down A midterm target in the form of enabling conditions is also included now RTA endorses the revision of the target

As part of the approval of Consensual Plan of Integration Corridors in National Plans in Jun 2015 the Government of Gabon has been designated to lead the process of obtaining for TRIDOM landscape status of Transboundary Biosphere Reserve MAB UNESCO

By EOP The Governments have adopted the legal instruments adopting the land use plan and they cover at least 80 of the 40000 sq km interzone and are published in the national press
By Midterm enabling conditions
i Complementary data collection is continued satellite images field checks etc
ii For each country updated thematic land use maps for the interzone and or existing protected areas are produced to serve as a basis for discussion
ii Land use scenarios ensuring that key connectivity areas receive conservation attention are proposed
iii Multilevel stakeholder consultation is conducted on proposed land use scenarios

description.narrative: 6 22 Master plans official endorsement

comment.narrative:
TRIDOM masterplan is designed and implemented in at least 20 of the project area
By Midterm enabling conditions abbreviated from PRODOC
i Preconditions
a An inventory of transboundary status and management models is conducted
b The results and recommendations of the inventory are discussed with all key stakeholders
c An action plan leading to adoption of an official status and transboundary management systems is adopted
ii By midterm
a A consensus is reached on proposed transboundary status of TRIDOM
b The trinational agreement on TRIDOM status signed
c The main orientations of the TRIDOM master plan operational rules management structures model collaborative management agreements including with indigenous people and zoning are outlined
d The TRIDOM management structures are outlined
e The participatory process to draft update protected area management plans is pursued in some areas
RTA note Target corrected to be in conformity with PRODOC Midterm enabling conditions now included

Progress made towards the target but not yet achieved only the preconditions for achieving the midterm target have been more or less fulfilled
These are ia progress towards official status ib some inventories exist ic a blueprint for a concerted management system is emerging but consensus is not yet achieved
MTR confirmed status for this indicator Jun 2012 is
It is first necessary to prepare national plans segment TRIDOM prior to the merger in a trinational Master Plan Participatory preparation of a draft will not be possible before 2014 a priori

description.narrative:
8 31 State of the TRIDOM ecological monitoring and control reports
RTA note indicator amended for clarity and conformity with PRODOC

comment.narrative:
Some basic information is available on TRIDOM from the CARPE report and the et Etat des foríªts report
RTA note baseline reconstructed based on correction inputted by the MTR

By midterm
TRIDOM annual monitoring reports completed and findings used to inform decisionmaking
By EOP
Final annual State of the TRIDOM including recommendations for the future is published
Mididterm enabling conditions
i The management agencies and partners in the interzone and existing protected areas adopt a monitoring strategy and a work plan defining roles and responsibilities on data collection and analysis
ii From Year 2 onwards monitoring data are included in a TRIDOM GIS database in close cooperation with GIS database systems used in existing protected areas and national GIS database systems
iii At least one partnership is concluded with a national or an international entity such as the foreseen Ipassa ecological research station Global Forest Watch etc to develop joint monitoring and training activities
iv At least 20 conservation and forest professionals in each country are trained in monitoring data collection protocol and analysis
RTA note Target corrected to be in conformity with PRODOC Midterm enabling conditions now included

Consolidation and structuring of a biodiversity monitoring system by setting up a GIS database based in line ministries fed through a spacetime AntiPoaching Ecological and socioeconomic monitoring device to facilitate decision making at various levels of management
This tool has the ability to communicate on 30Km bands on each side of the borders the location and trends The correlation between poaching hotspots areas of concentration of large mammals and location of crossing points of large mammals and poachers at the borders of countries The likelihood of quantitative and qualitative observation of elephants and gorillas in and around the 17 blocks drive favorite clearings setting community supervision Simple phenology of species most palatable plants around the blocks clearings and continuous monitoring The cartographic recognition and determination of the network and the degree of use of migration corridors of large mammal The observation of aquatic fauna in segments of streams of high Ivindo and Middle Dja The crossanalysis of the observations of the Great Mammals trends in protected areas and key corridors of the central core of TRIDOM

By midterm
TRIDOM annual monitoring reports completed and findings used to inform decisionmaking
By EOP
Final annual State of the TRIDOM including recommendations for the future is published

iii At least one partnership is concluded with a national or an international entity such as the foreseen Ipassa ecological research station Global Forest Watch etc to develop joint monitoring and training activities
iv At least 20 conservation and forest professionals in each country are trained in monitoring data collection protocol and analysis
RTA note Target corrected to be in conformity with PRODOC Midterm enabling conditions now included

description.narrative:
LEGACY INDICADOR 10
Note This indicator was misplaced it has now been moved immediately above to 23
41 Endorsement of operational procedures for monitoring
MTR 2012 comments
MIKE has been replaced by MIST but it is not directly related to law enforcement
For the purposes of the law itself some actions have been taken as the establishment of monitoring committees of litigation including two in Gabon
RTA Note Indicator was misplaced and it is now moved to Outcome 2 Output 3 immediately above

comment.narrative:
LEGACY BASELINE FOR INDICADOR 10
MIKE Monitoring of Illegal Killing of Elephant project only effective in Minkébé National Park need for monitoring strategy for the entire TRIDOM landscape

LEGACY TARGET FOR INDICADOR 10
Interim monitoring strategy implemented in entire TRIDOM
RTA note Target corrected to be in conformity with PRODOC

The binational border patrols officially launched since July 2013 continued in the second half of 2014 and were particularly disrupted by a major operation called Top of the INTERPOL Ivindo in November 2014 triggering the process of calling upon sponsors and the reconstitution of crossborder links in the chain of poaching
Thus in the functioning of the judiciary committee of the three States Parties for the monitoring of crossborder litigation on wildlife crossborder operations Judicial proceedings following the successive arrest by binational patrols Minkébé National Park in Gabon of four shipments of elephant poachers from Cameroon and Congo denounced their sponsors during the investigation who were immediately placed under arrest through the crossborder cooperation of the judiciary involved in the INTERPOL On the basis of numerous other arrests authors accomplices and coauthors of elephant poaching were also arrested
To this end sentences are being issued and several criminal networks are being undone at local and international level
Furthermore the traditional chains of prosecution were considered the weak links as previously only members of indigenous and village communities were the subject of criminal prosecution while sponsors had little to worry about

LEGACY TARGET FOR INDICADOR 10
Interim monitoring strategy implemented in entire TRIDOM
RTA note Target corrected to be in conformity with PRODOC

The binational border patrols officially launched since July 2013 continued in the second half of 2014 and were particularly disrupted by a major operation called Top of the INTERPOL Ivindo in November 2014 triggering the process of calling upon sponsors and the reconstitution of crossborder links in the chain of poaching
Thus in the functioning of the judiciary committee of the three States Parties for the monitoring of crossborder litigation on wildlife crossborder operations Judicial proceedings following the successive arrest by binational patrols Minkébé National Park in Gabon of four shipments of elephant poachers from Cameroon and Congo denounced their sponsors during the investigation who were immediately placed under arrest through the crossborder cooperation of the judiciary involved in the INTERPOL On the basis of numerous other arrests authors accomplices and coauthors of elephant poaching were also arrested
To this end sentences are being issued and several criminal networks are being undone at local and international level
Furthermore the traditional chains of prosecution were considered the weak links as previously only members of indigenous and village communities were the subject of criminal prosecution while sponsors had little to worry about

comment.narrative:
16a Community hunting is regulated in the existing legislation
16b Baseline to be defined in YR 1 during socioeconomic assessment

16a By midterm a pragmatic legal framework for community forest wildlife management including community hunting was adopted in each of the tree countries
By EOP in each country segment of the interzone at least five communitybased forest andor wildlife management zones are providing steady legal revenues to local actors as a result of the project efforts
16b No targets established

In the Odzala National Park in Congo Kokoua the fund of villagers after 5 growth in turnover of ecotourism revenues the Congo Conservation Society is rapidly growing in proportion with the increase in the number of tourists related capacityrange means of childcare It is worth noting that tax regulations to enable a fair distribution of these benefits for the development of all village land is not yet established Also the National Park will need to recruit a powerful development expert to assist local communities who is capable of designing projects that are in line with conservation of biodiversity

After supporting the facilitation of the valorization of Odzala National Park in CongoKokoua the following issues have become a challenge
Decrease in the number of tourists that visit the Park
Impact of limitation on the local population
The possible Resolution
Trigger future community tourism blocks clearings surveillance in the interzone and community hunting tourism
During fiscal year 20142015 the objective was to deepen the implementation process of hunting areas identified last year and research valuation opportunities But the reluctance of operators to invest because of a possible slow return on investment
To work around this major difficulty we strongly hope that the new phase TRIDOM Project development can grant
Support the establishment of EcoLodge in village land management pilots
Acquisition in accordance with CITES export quotas parrots community to collect in glades in community supervision in TalaTala FMU Ngombe and Congo

description.narrative:
15 61 Number of local jobs in ecotourism enterprises

The ecotourism development requires a clear identification of potential and partnerships with the private sector developers to make the necessary investments and promoting the offer

comment.narrative: Baseline to be defined after YR 1 of project implementation RTA Note It was not established

By midterm in each pilot site at least 15 community members have stable direct employment as a result of ecotourism development
By EOP in each pilot site at least 25 community members have stable direct employment as a result of ecotourism development
The number of days spent by tourists in the TRIDOM increased by at least 15 per year since Year 4
RTA note Target corrected to be in conformity with PRODOC

Commissioning the Odzala Kokoua National Park by Congo Conservation Company Tour Operator has contributed for the creation of additional 15 increase in job opportunities for the local communities compared to the previous year

comment.narrative: Baseline will be defined during YR 1 through socioeconomic assessment

By EOP income generated from ecotourism development and communitybased forest and wildlife management in the areas targeted by the project have induced local populations to stop unsustainable natural resources harvesting
Midterm enabling conditions abridged from PRODOC
a In each country the process leading to one additional community forest or community hunting zone is initiated in the interzone and around protected areas
b A microfinance facility and training in business planning and financing targeting communitybased biodiversity enterprises is implemented in each country
c In each country one additional community forest or community hunting zone is established
d A draft program to set up a microfinance facility and training in business planning and financing targeting community
based biodiversity enterprises is designed and discussed in each country
e In each country segment as a result of the project efforts at least five communitybased forest and or wildlife management are providing steady legal revenues to local actors as a result of the project efforts
RTA note Target corrected to be in conformity with PRODOC Midterm enabling conditions now added

Strengthening the Structural Development Plan for 17 key village lands on participatory management of wildlife for the reduction of poaching
a Setting up a Community monitoring component blocks adjacent to the village land clearings with five targeted effects
Protection de facto because of the almost permanent presence on the sites
Ecological Dynamics recolonization by GM clearing and restoring corridors
Socio economic term development of ecotourism homestay
Sociocultural consideration wildlife financial resources instead of food
Applied Research Dynamics Monitoring populations in the Great Mammals
NB
In order to enable the triggering of community tourism perspective in clearings blockcrossing monitoring the new phase of TRIDOM Project provides
Awards grants to support the viewpoints of installation and ecolodge in the 17 pilot village land management
Obtaining in accordance with Community CITES export quotas parrots to take in clearings in community supervision in parrots
b Component Conversion Termination poachers and similar
Implementation of an innovative approach to reducing the large poaching through support for rehabilitation and or strengthening of income generating activities IGA leaders of the green economy in strategic village lands agreeing to engage in a joint venture labor after members of the Association for the social conversion of poachers and similar TRIDOM landscape ARBRAT
The following actions were taken
Participatory identification of leaders of the village economy and income generating activities IGA in forest areas suitable and compatible with the conservation of biodiversity
Identification of poachers and the like with enrollment in the Association for the social restructuring of poachers professionals ARBRAT created for the occasion with the support of TRIDOM Project to serve as a priority for labor development Bank AGR
Signature of the Single Support Grants for the development of AGR
Identification and motivation for processing and marketing of products
Simple Plan monitoring of hunting pressure yield hunting effort
Simple Plan monitoring the pressure of agriculture yield fallow management and the fight against slash and burn shifting cultivation
Plan followed by the conversion and reporting of targets on poaching

This covers lt 30 of the core management costs in the TRIDOM
The Financial Scorecard has not yet been applied

description.narrative: To maintain the ecological functions and connectivity of TRIDOM and ensure longterm conservation of its protected area system through integrated sustainable and participatory management in the interzone between the protected areas

1a 1 Population of key species selected as indicators of improved protection from threats in TRIDOM
1a elephant and great ape
MTR 2012 comments
Unrealistic indicator establishing a baseline and inventory populations represent a job and a very high cost of such a zone Existing data are limited and require an update
Even performing sampling the cost is very important and measuring a change would be very difficult to statistically validate

comment.narrative:
Baseline for elephant and great ape populations to be defined after YR 1 2 of project implementation
2013 note Baseline not yet established

By midterm
Elephant and great ape populations are stabilized or have increased in TRIDOM compared to levels at YR 1
By EOP
Elephant and great ape populations are stabilized or have increased in TRIDOM compared to levels at Year 1
2013 note Not possible to establish targets because baseline was not established
RTA note Target in PIR corrected to be in conformity with PRODOC

During the interface between two inventories Great Mammals This indicator is filled through the probability of observing elephants and gorillas in clearings blocks in community supervision But following the end of the operational phase of the project which was completed at the end of December 2014 and the nonappropriation of the practice by the State Parties the data was only collected between July and December 2014 Thus 1417 CBM blocks in clearings were recolonized in the dry season with an oscillating observation probability from 0125 to 016 against 010 to 0125 last year on a sequence of 02 visits by the clearing day The ideal would be to achieve a rate of 025 for tour operators offer a Bottom Line a Community ecotourist destination Also breeding groups and large individuals continued to be observed in clearings of blocks in the forests and Messok Dja DjouaIvindo in the Congo Besides the recognition of crossborder network migration paths of elephants between protected areas of the three countries indicated very good connections between Congo and Gabon connections relatively well between Congo and Cameroon and between Cameroon and Gabon via the North West Congo and lack a connection between Gabon and Cameroon

By midterm
Elephant and great ape populations are stabilized or have increased in TRIDOM compared to levels at YR 1
By EOP
Elephant and great ape populations are stabilized or have increased in TRIDOM compared to levels at Year 1
2013 note Not possible to establish targets because baseline was not established
RTA note Target in PIR corrected to be in conformity with PRODOC

During the interface between two inventories Great Mammals This indicator is filled through the probability of observing elephants and gorillas in clearings blocks in community supervision But following the end of the operational phase of the project which was completed at the end of December 2014 and the nonappropriation of the practice by the State Parties the data was only collected between July and December 2014 Thus 1417 CBM blocks in clearings were recolonized in the dry season with an oscillating observation probability from 0125 to 016 against 010 to 0125 last year on a sequence of 02 visits by the clearing day The ideal would be to achieve a rate of 025 for tour operators offer a Bottom Line a Community ecotourist destination Also breeding groups and large individuals continued to be observed in clearings of blocks in the forests and Messok Dja DjouaIvindo in the Congo Besides the recognition of crossborder network migration paths of elephants between protected areas of the three countries indicated very good connections between Congo and Gabon connections relatively well between Congo and Cameroon and between Cameroon and Gabon via the North West Congo and lack a connection between Gabon and Cameroon

description.narrative:
2 2 Percentage of TRIDOM free of hunting
MTR 2012 comments
It is impossible to measure this indicator Hunting happens all over the TRIDOM area including in national parks and especially around the villages
Hunting itself is not a problem as long as it is not done on a large scale for sale on the domestic and international markets and it is not poaching ie hunting in the national parks excluding the opening periods and do not respect the protected species and quotas enforced by law

comment.narrative:
Baseline for level of hunting to be defined after YR 1 of project implementation
2013 note The baseline not yet established though there are many studies

By midterm
The percentage of surface area without bush meat hunting is stabilized or has increased compared to levels at Year 1 in 50 of TRIDOM through an effective law enforcement system and collaborative management schemes with the private sector and communities
By EOP
The overall percentage of TRIDOM without bush meat hunting has increased compared to levels at Year 1 through an effective law enforcement system and collaborative management schemes with the private sector and communities
Ancillary metaindicator proposed by MTR in Jun 2012
The average distance covered on foot by village hunters is stabilized or has decreased compared to levels at Year 1
RTA note Target in PIR corrected to be in conformity with PRODOC

The implementation of simple Management Plans under the management of 17 pilot village lands hotspot for poaching for poverty reduction and antipoaching and maintaining or restoring the network migration of large mammals track continued only during July to December 2014 It is noted that the expansion of the hotspots could not be reached as planned because of the ineffective mobilization of the private sector This initiative of Participatory Management Approach has met with very positive response not only of the State Parties but also local beneficiaries Community supervision blocks clearings allowed recolonization of 1417 block large mammals and should in future be reinforced by a cover of 3030 days into two teams of 1530 days The second wave of development support Revenues Generating Activities IGA compatible with the conservation of biodiversity with integration of nontimber forest products processing machinery NTFPs could not be reached for lack of financial availability Thus Poachers Conversion Plan has not been effective as there were no permanent occupation for antipoachers The average effort of hunting in the village land has not seen a significant difference compared to last year In short this uncertain ownership by the beneficiaries is due to the short duration of experimentation 15 7 years As a result the establishment of a Transitional Strategy is necessary prior to the new phase of project development so as to avoid the risk of losing this important achievement

By midterm
The percentage of surface area without bush meat hunting is stabilized or has increased compared to levels at Year 1 in 50 of TRIDOM through an effective law enforcement system and collaborative management schemes with the private sector and communities
By EOP
The overall percentage of TRIDOM without bush meat hunting has increased compared to levels at Year 1 through an effective law enforcement system and collaborative management schemes with the private sector and communities
Ancillary metaindicator proposed by MTR in Jun 2012
The average distance covered on foot by village hunters is stabilized or has decreased compared to levels at Year 1
RTA note Target in PIR corrected to be in conformity with PRODOC

The implementation of simple Management Plans under the management of 17 pilot village lands hotspot for poaching for poverty reduction and antipoaching and maintaining or restoring the network migration of large mammals track continued only during July to December 2014 It is noted that the expansion of the hotspots could not be reached as planned because of the ineffective mobilization of the private sector This initiative of Participatory Management Approach has met with very positive response not only of the State Parties but also local beneficiaries Community supervision blocks clearings allowed recolonization of 1417 block large mammals and should in future be reinforced by a cover of 3030 days into two teams of 1530 days The second wave of development support Revenues Generating Activities IGA compatible with the conservation of biodiversity with integration of nontimber forest products processing machinery NTFPs could not be reached for lack of financial availability Thus Poachers Conversion Plan has not been effective as there were no permanent occupation for antipoachers The average effort of hunting in the village land has not seen a significant difference compared to last year In short this uncertain ownership by the beneficiaries is due to the short duration of experimentation 15 7 years As a result the establishment of a Transitional Strategy is necessary prior to the new phase of project development so as to avoid the risk of losing this important achievement

description.narrative:
1b 1 Population of key species selected as indicators of improved protection from threats in TRIDOM
1b Nile crocodiles slender snout crocodiles giant turtles and Congo clawless otters
MTR 2012 comments
Impossible to measure captures without having guards present at all times In terms of management agreements WWF implements some activities However it is difficult to measure indicators but what is done is still in the direction of providing data on trends To specifically inform the indicator even in small areas there should be regular surveys to measure the trend but the cost would be very high

comment.narrative:
Baseline for populations of Nile crocodiles slender snout crocodiles giant turtles and Congo clawless otters to be defined after YR 1 of project implementation
2013 note Baseline not yet established

By midterm
A collaborative management agreement is under negotiation for each of the pilot river segments to assure community involvement in protection of aquatic resources
By EOP
In at least two pilot river sites per country populations of Nile crocodiles slender snout crocodiles giant turtles and Congo clawless otters are stabilized or have increased
2013 note Not possible to establish targets because baseline was not established
RTA note Target in PIR corrected to be in conformity with PRODOC

Following the operational closure of the Project the implementation of last years followup protocol was only continued during the period from JulyDecember 2014 However the trends identified did not have difference with those of the previous fiscal year

description.narrative: 3 3 Funding levels

comment.narrative:
Baseline will be established in YR 1 through analysis of costs and funding sources
As per PRODOC million in 2007
1 Project PA budgets in TRIDOM 2629
2 Project nonPA budgets in TRIDOM 0094
3 Government PA budgets in TRIDOM 2157
4 Government nonPA budgets in TRIDOM 0901
TOTAL 1 through 4 5781
Subtotal 1 and 3 4786
in a different calculation baseline finance for the duration of the project was assessed at 92 million or 13 million pa this is a more credible figure
This covers lt 10 of the core management costs in the TRIDOM

Not possible to inform the indicator with precision
However we report the following
It is already planned recruitment in the next second half of 2013 a consultant to conduct a study on the compilation of existing recurrent costs of monitoring sources of funding GAP and potential local sources of finacing to mobilize sustainable income from payments for environmental services Moreover a working group has been set up during the same semester discuss proposals for a draft taxation on wildlife vision tourism and wildlife hunting tourism submit to the Government of the Congo the development this of activity in the OdzalaKokoua and Park and its periphery

The document on the determination of the recurrent costs for the ongoing monitoring of biodiversity for crossborder activities is still pending approval by State Parties Therefore this activity should be within the framework of the new project phase which is under development

Not possible to inform the indicator with precision
However we report the following
It is already planned recruitment in the next second half of 2013 a consultant to conduct a study on the compilation of existing recurrent costs of monitoring sources of funding GAP and potential local sources of finacing to mobilize sustainable income from payments for environmental services Moreover a working group has been set up during the same semester discuss proposals for a draft taxation on wildlife vision tourism and wildlife hunting tourism submit to the Government of the Congo the development this of activity in the OdzalaKokoua and Park and its periphery

The document on the determination of the recurrent costs for the ongoing monitoring of biodiversity for crossborder activities is still pending approval by State Parties Therefore this activity should be within the framework of the new project phase which is under development
